column5: I just thought i would share this cuz it could come in handy for hook- ups or meetings...actually see exactly where you are going ...i actually got playing with it and if you know someones address....you can virtually see their house @ street level  http://www.vpike.com   Cheers
My 82 year old father just showed me that site this morning, way better coverage at street level than google

Yeah, I saw that it was tied to google by the logo, but, the last time I was on google it did not have street level for anywhere between Hamilton and Niagara Falls. Just tried google again and see my house there. Google has expanded their coverage recently, my mistake, thought the new site had better coverage.
wow, mighty good stuff! Thanks for sharing it!

just checked out my place.I can see my neighbour getting out of her car and can see exactally what se has in her hands..This is wild stuff man. Just goes to show big brother is watching ( if they want to)
Almost Kinda creepy.  I saw on teh news a while back that if ended up in a street level shot, which people were, you could get it removed.

last sumer while working the google maps car drove by. We were talking about it the other day so i thought i would check it out and sure enough  you can go that adress aqnd see us working. funny thing is that we were working at a corner and the first time the car went by we are working the second time we are on break

Hard to believe that not more people know about this. My house pic was taken June 4th '09. I can tell by which vehicles are in the driveway, the progress of the hanging baskets and flowers and the recycling bin out on the curb.
somebody left the door open on my truck!! OMG!! i just zoomed in on my grandpas place and hes out cutting his lawn!!!! LMAO
Who is that guy with my wife in my driveway?   Cheers  Craig
Google Opt Out Feature Lets Users Protect Privacy By Moving To Remote Village
Thread title is misleading. Was expecting to see virtual fish!
I see they were around while I was at work. My Honda is parked out on the side street. Thank god it was nice and clean and shiny!!!!!!
How true Clofchik.....how true....i guess my street isnt important enough to be worth the bother of filming ...
Google expanded nearly everywhere and that vpike site went viral as if they magically created it.  Tis a shame.
